metadata.title: LA-CALC-2.6 Limits at Infinity
metadata.creator: jason_wang
metadata.abstract: This document is for testing purposes only. The material that is presented here should be treated as an example only.

stack.p: For f(x) a real function, the limit of f as x approaches infinity is L, denoted $\lim_{x\to\infty} f(x) = L$. In this module, we will learn to find the limit of rational function as x approches to infinity.
The simulation below shows the plot of the following function. Modify the value of $\,x\,$ using the slider below, and observe the change of $f(x)$.

slider.name: xSlider
slider.onValueChanged: local input = round(xSlider.Value,0.15) if(input~=preValue) then updateData1(input) drawPlot1(input) preValue=input end
